poem:
**Downing Street, Again**

So much depends  
upon

a paper  
promised

folded in the fist  
of No. 10

backbenchers  
murmur like rain

Rayner—  
plain voice

Hillier—  
a hand on the brake

and Starmer,  
suit creased by repetition,

lets the files  
be vetted

as if truth  
were a cabinet

you can close  
quietly.
